TopicTitle: Best computer to run KSP on highest settings?

Articles.Content: I am planning on saving up and buying a really nice computer. I want it to easily be able to play ksp on the highest settings. What kind of hardware should I get? Throw anything at me. I'm not too worried about the price. Just nothing insane like $2000+
Any modern gaming PC goes... just get one hell of a CPU!
Nowadays you want more RAM, as the upgrade to unity 4 (I think) stepped down on the CPU time but increased RAM load.

KSP is a 32 BIT application; I would love to see it go 64 though. The speed of RAM is important, but any amount over 6 GB would be overkill; 4 for maximum storage of the game data and 2 for the rest of windows to store, is more the enough (on a 64 Bit system). I would put my money on the CPU horse.

No, KSP runs 100% fine on my 64 bit laptop, no tweaking of settings.
Sure it does, it runs fine on my 64 Bit desktop too. But that doesn't make it a 64 Bit application. A 64 Bit OS runs both 32 and 64, but only 64 Bit applications support a higher amount of RAM than 4 GB. I've never seen KSP using over 3,9 GB of RAM and I have 12 GB installed.

Actually you can crank the graphics settings up pretty high with low budget cards. The lag comes from the physics delta time. The problem really is CPU and RAM time. My computer is 5 years old and I have all the graphics set to max. I just can't build any ships over 200ish parts before the old CPU starts making funny noises

I know the Linux version has a 64 bit binary available, and I'm not sure about the Mac version.

I also don't know if Unity3D can take advantage of segmented memory. If it can, a 64bit binary can access more the 4GB, if not, then well it can't.

I am planning on saving up and buying a really nice computer. I want it to easily be able to play ksp on the highest settings. What kind of hardware should I get? Throw anything at me. I'm not too worried about the price. Just nothing insane like $2000+

What matters most is your cpu and even more important amount of ram. As long as you got a half decent cpu and minimum 4gig of ram it should run pretty fine.

When it comes to GPU pretty much any GPUs will do fine as long as they got dedicated ram instead of shared.

KSP has actually relatively low requirements. I've got an older mid-class cpu Athlon X4 640 3Ghz and just docked a 360 and a 150 part ship without bigger problems. Navigating and time acceleration is a bit slow, but works fine otherwise, since the game slows the time down to some degree. Of course, you need more patience this way. Until now the game didn't use more than 4gb ram, but this seems highly relateted to the ammount of mods you use. Still, i'd recommend at least 8gb.

But I dont' think you should measure your new pc on the requirements of KSP if you also want to play other games. The next console generation will bring a big step forwards in graphics and physics. Especially the last one was very limited with this generation. The best, or at least less costly idea would be to wait for the next consoles. That will show you how good your hardware needs to be for the new games. And more importantly, competition will also pick up, since many gamers will again have reasons to upgrade their systems, so the prices will go down.
